required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Advice Protocol to Reduce the Level of Exposure to Metallic Trace Elements (ETM)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation of the Effectiveness of a Counseling Protocol to Reduce the Level of Exposure to Metallic Trace Elements (ETM)

brief_summary.textblock: A French company (Toxseek, France, has developed a scientifically validated screening test based on a capillary determination of pollutants on a 3 cm lock of hair. The results of this screening allow physicians to discuss with their patients the question of environmental health and provide them with personalized behavioral advice in an attempt to eliminate the source of the pollutants identified.The main objective of the study is to assess the effectiveness of behavioral counseling on reducing the level of exposure to metal-type environmental pollutants (MTE) in pregnant women or women planning to have children.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who reduced their level of exposure within 4 months of metal avoidance advice.
primary_outcome.description: The patient will be considered "successful" for the reduction of the exposure level, if all the metals with a "risky" exposure level during the 1st screening have gone to an exposure level "to be monitored" or "acceptable" during the 2nd screening.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pregnant women or woman in desire for conception
arm_group.description: Towseek test : hair taking different questionnaires : environmental questionnaire, compliance questionnaire

intervention.arm_group_label: Pregnant women or woman in desire for conception

study_pop.textblock: Women, over 18 years old, pregnant (first trimester) or desires conception

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women over 18 years old
- Patient with desire to conceive
- 1st trimester of pregnancy
- Patient having been informed of the study and not opposing the use of the data collected
- Affiliate or beneficiary of a social security scheme
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women under 18 years old
- 2nd and 3rd trimester of pregnancy
- Patient objecting to the use of the data collected
- Protected patient: adult under tutorship, curatorship or other protection legal, deprived of liberty by judicial or administrative decision
